productCategories.name: Bank
productCategories.description: I need a day to day transactional account

products.name: Business Pay-As-You-Use
products.shortDescription: This product provides a safe and convenient cashless payment mechanism for goods and services, a safe depository for excess capital and access to credit facilities on application. Clients only pay for the transactions they use.
salesHighlights: Low monthly maintenance fees, pay-as-you-use pricing.
Full transactional account with linked cheque card and electronic/mobile banking access.
Access to the full range of business solutions, including point-of-sale devices, financing and investment options and other value-added services.
Earn Greenbacks loyalty points on your card spend.
Reduces the need to operate with large amounts of cash.
A vehicle for accessing other financial services
significance: Provides full transactional functionality and options for an overdraft, a credit card and business lending.

productFeatures.name: Target Market
productFeatures.description: For new and established businesses (with a sound credit record ) within SBS, Business Banking and Professional Banking.

productFeatures.name: Key Selling Points
productFeatures.description: > This is a pay-as-you use account that gives you the flexibility to bank the way you want | > You only pay for the transactions you use | > Enjoy acess to the complete range of current account features and facilities, free balance enquiries on electronic channels, free internet banking statements.| > Allows a client to build a credit history for access to lending products.

productFeatures.name: Competitor Landscape
productFeatures.description: Similar products offered: | ABSA: Business Essentials | FNB: Gold Business Account | Standard Bank: Business CA

productFeatures.name: Legal Documents Required
productFeatures.description: > Application for transactional current account - juristic person (company, close corporation, partnership, trusts) | > Terms and conditions of transactional current account | > Standard FICA process and documents as required by compliance (e.g. the process of verifying physical addresses and signature specimens)

productLines.name: CashSolutions
productLines.description: A customised cash-handling service for your business.

productCategories.name: GetFinance

productLines.name: Loans
productLines.description: To start up, grow, offer flexibility or manage debt.

productCategories.name: MerchantService
productCategories.description: Identifies a Transfer Service that provides transaction processing and reconciliation services for merchants that accept non-cash payment methods such as credit cards' debit cards' and point-of-sale cards.

productCategories.name: CreditFacilities
productCategories.description: To meet a client's needs in offering a Credit Facility where the Financial Institution extends credit to another Involved Party in the form of actual funds' or as an obligation to provide funds in the future under specific conditions.  A Credit Facility is an Account in its own right e.g. a Line Of Credit.

productLines.name: LineOfCredit
productLines.description: Identifies a Credit Facility where the Customer is allowed a predetermined limit and may borrow as much of the &quot;line&quot; as required until the limit is reached. The borrower pays interest on the borrowed portion only with repayments linked to the amount of credit in use. As the outstanding credit amount is repaid the amount of credit available increases up to the original limit; for example' an overdraft on a current account' a commercial line of credit' a revolving line of credit.

productLines.name: Debtor Management
productLines.description: A range of solutions aimed at assisting growth-orientated companies to grow as our funding unlocks cash that had previously been tied up in the debtor's book. Companies that have a mismatch between debtor and creditor payments are ideal factoring clients.

productLines.name: Letter of Guarantee
productLines.description: A Nedbank letter of guarantee (LG/bank guarantee) is a contract that states that Nedbank will financially meet a commitment a client makes to a third party should the client default on payments or performance, in the case of a performance guarantee or once an action has taken place, in the case of a property guarantee or a demand guarantee. A letter of guarantee allows the client to offer the financial guarantee needed to secure a business deal that the client may not necessarily be able to acquire otherwise.

productLines.name: Commercial Line Of Credit
productLines.description: Identifies a Line Of Credit whose purpose is to aid cashflow for corporate customers' and is not normally made available to retail customers.

productLines.name: Letter of Credit
productLines.description: Identifies a Credit Facility where the Customer is allowed a predetermined limit and may borrow as much of the &quot;line&quot; as required until the limit is reached. The borrower pays interest on the borrowed portion only with repayments linked to the amount of credit in use. As the outstanding credit amount is repaid the amount of credit available increases up to the original limit; for example' an overdraft on a current account' a commercial line of credit' a revolving line of credit.

productLines.name: Credit Card Line Of Credit
productLines.description: Identifies a Line Of Credit Facility where the Customer accesses the line of credit by use of a plastic card which is widely accepted by retailers.

productCategories.name: Access mechanism
productCategories.description: To meet a client's needs in offering an Access Mechanism whereby a customer can obtain access to another Product.

productLines.name: Electronic Service
productLines.description: This Service is offered by the Bank to clients' allowing them to access their bank accounts and/or third party accounts electronically.

productCategories.name: Borrowing money
productCategories.description: To meet a client's financial need to borrow money to facilitate the purchase of a small or significant asset -unsecured or secured.  This includes personal loans for incidental high value expenses to Vehicle and Home Loans.

productLines.name: Lease
productLines.description: A financial facility offered by the Bank whereby equipment and/or vehicles selected by the client' are purchased by the Bank and then rented onto the client.  Ownership remains vested with the Bank.

productLines.name: Rental
productLines.description: A financial facility offered by the Bank whereby goods selected by the client' are purchased by the Bank and then rented onto the client.  Ownership does not pass at the end of the agreement.

productLines.name: Instalment Sale
productLines.description: Defined as a credit transaction entered into with a credit grantor whereby moveable' durable goods are sold to a consumer and all or part of the price is deferred.
